The Race for the Moon: This film would recount the intense competition between the United States and the Soviet Union to be the first to land a manned spacecraft on the moon. The story would follow the astronauts, engineers, and politicians who made this historic achievement possible, capturing the high-stakes drama and the spirit of innovation and exploration.

The Discovery of Penicillin: A young Alexander Fleming makes a groundbreaking discovery in his laboratory, leading to the development of penicillin. The film would show the challenges and setbacks Fleming faces, as well as the political and social climate of the time, highlighting the importance of his discovery in the fight against bacterial infections.

The Fall of the Berlin Wall: A drama set against the backdrop of the Cold War, this film would follow the events leading up to the fall of the Berlin Wall, focusing on the everyday people who played a pivotal role in the unification of Germany. The story would capture the hopes and fears of the people, as well as the political and economic changes that occurred in the aftermath of the fall.

The D-Day Invasion: A war epic following the planning and execution of the D-Day invasion, this film would showcase the bravery and sacrifice of the Allied forces as they attempt to turn the tide of World War II. The story would focus on the leaders, soldiers, and civilians who played a crucial role in this historic event, capturing the tension and drama of the invasion.

The Apollo 13 Mission: This film would recount the harrowing story of the Apollo 13 mission, which suffered a catastrophic malfunction just days before it was supposed to land on the moon. The story would follow the astronauts, the ground crew, and the engineers who worked tirelessly to bring the crew back to Earth safely.
